content: In this Act, the term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate and the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives. The "Naval Vessel Transfer Act of 2013" authorizes the transfer of naval vessels to Mexico and Taiwan. The President can grant the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates USS CURTS and USS MCCLUSKY to Mexico. Additionally, the President can sell the USS TAYLOR, USS GARY, USS CARR, and USS ELROD to the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office in the United States. The "Naval Vessel Transfer Act of 2013" authorizes the transfer of naval vessels to Mexico and Taiwan. The President can grant specific vessels to specific countries, subject to conditions, without exceeding the total number of vessels authorized for transfer. The value of a vessel transferred on a grant basis shall not count against the aggregate value of excess defense articles. The authority to transfer a vessel under this section shall not be counted against the aggregate value of excess defense articles. Any expenses incurred by the US in connection with a transfer shall be charged to the recipient. The President may require repair or refurbishment of the vessel in a US shipyard before joining the recipient's naval forces. The authority to transfer a vessel expires after a 3-year period. The authority to transfer a vessel under this section expires after a 3-year period from the enactment of this Act.
